fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59261].
  {panel}

The Screen used for a Transition can be defined two different ways:

# In Diagram mode, select the Transition, then click Edit in the pane on the right. This pops up an Edit Transition window with a drop-down for *Screen*
# In Text Mode, select the Transition, then click the Edit button at the top right. This loads a new page to edit the transition with a drop-down for *Transition View*

Also, while in Diagram Mode, select the Transition, then one of the advanced functions such as Validators. From here you can Edit, reaching the same screen as in #2.

There are two problems. First is the inconsistent naming between these, Screen vs. Transition View.

Second, using the Default Classic Workflow, we can see that there's a disconnect between these two fields (Screen and Transition View). Using method #2, edit the Close transition and note that the Transition View is the Resolve screen. Then use method #1 to edit the Close transition and note that the Screen is None.

If you change the screen using method #1 from None to Default Screen, save it, then edit the transition using method #2, you will see that the Transition View has been changed to Default Screen.

This confirms that both Screen and Transition View are the same, but for some reason, the editing window provided by Diagram Mode isn't always displaying the same data as the Text mode.

This affects previous versions of JIRA as well (back to 6.3.5 at least).
fields.summary: Differences in Transition Screen set via Diagram vs. Text modes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* When *Anonymous User* access a ticket in JIRA, clicking on the activity tab will result to a rendering exception error
* Is not experienced with *logged-in* user

h3. Environment
* This exception will only shows if you set up SSL/HTTPS  in your instance
* If no SSL/HTTPS configured, will show the following [JRA-45580|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-45580]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a fresh clean server instance
# Configure HTTPS by following this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/running-jira-over-ssl-or-https-124008.html]
# Create a new project and issue
# Change the permission for the project to allow 'anyone' to browse project/administer project
# Log out
# Go to any of the issue from the new project
# Click on the history/activity tab

h3. Expected Results
Able to see the activity tab 

h3. Actual Results
* Below exception is thrown
!activity_bug.png|thumbnail! 
 !activity_bug1.png|thumbnail! 

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{code}
2016-01-06 22:37:31,413 http-bio-8443-exec-10 ERROR anonymous 1357x729x1 kxcehs 127.0.0.1 /browse/AS-1 [c.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager] MethodInvocationException occurred getting message body from Velocity: com.atlassian.templaterenderer.RenderingException: org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getHtml' in  class com.atlassian.streams.jira.portlet.ActivityStreamIssueTab$1 threw exception com.atlassian.gadgets.GadgetParsingException: org.apache.shindig.gadgets.GadgetException: Unable to retrieve gadget xml. HTTP error 500 at viewissue/activityblock.vm[line 58, column 27]
com.atlassian.templaterenderer.RenderingException: org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getHtml' in  class com.atlassian.streams.jira.portlet.ActivityStreamIssueTab$1 threw exception com.atlassian.gadgets.GadgetParsingException: org.apache.shindig.gadgets.GadgetException: Unable to retrieve gadget xml. HTTP error 500 at viewissue/activityblock.vm[line 58, column 27]
{code}
{code}
Caused by: com.atlassian.gadgets.GadgetParsingException: org.apache.shindig.gadgets.GadgetException: Unable to retrieve gadget xml. HTTP error 500
{code}

h3.Workaround
Only workaround is to log in.

h3.Updates 20th June 2018
New behavior is observed when setting JIRA with Apache SSL as per KB: https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/integrating-jira-with-apache-using-ssl-802593043.html

# Anonymous user access JIRA via proxy/SSL, view an issue, click on Activity Stream and same error observed.
# Login with an internal user account, access JIRA via proxy/SSL. View the same issue and click on Activity Stream and error observed. Note that in previous scenario, once user login the error should be gone.
# Bypass proxy and login with the same internal user account, view the same issue and now able to view the activity stream details.
# This is reproducible with different types of proxy such as Apache and Microsoft TMG.
fields.summary: Activity tab showing RenderingException if used by Anonymous user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59259].
  {panel}

h3. Original Description
In my project, labels are omitted from the view/edit screen. I am aware from JRA-28788 that labels can still be edited within this configuration, but that the pencil icon will not be visible. However:

# When viewing the issue itself (see URL), the pencil icon is absent, as expected. !image-2016-01-06-14-02-28-725.png|thumbnail! - viewing the issue itself now leaves inline editing enabled as a result of the sidebar being present when viewing an issue.
# When viewing the issue from the project issue list, the pencil icon unexpectedly appears. !image-2016-01-06-14-00-48-397.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps

    Turn off Inline Edit in the General Configuration
    Visit a view issue page via the issue navigator
    Click on a field, e.g. priority

h3. Expectation

Nothing happens.

h3. Reality

The field is edited inline.

h3. Notes

The bug is not present in JIRA 6.4.9, but is present in JIRA 7.0.0.
This is also affecting normal issue view in JIRA Cloud v1000.110.0.
fields.summary: Inline edit configuration is not being respected
@mention should prioritize username over the name of the user
Move sub tasks as sub task of another JIRA (Task, Issue or Improvements etc.)
Ability to Customize Components With Colours

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the documentation for [Importing issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracloud/importing-issues-737772291.html] using External System Import does not mention quite a few of the other options:

!Screen Shot 2016-01-06 at 11.35.41.jpg|thumbnail!

We don't have documentation for any of these.

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the documentation to include these other importers.
fields.summary: Various importer options not mentioned in External System Import documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attaching an attachment and linking it in the comment using Wiki Markup, clicking on the attachment in the Comment section uses a different URL from clicking on it from the Attachment section. This poses a problem when there are spaces in the name. For example, I attached a file named {{code alert 1.xml}}. These are the URLs from both sections

||Attachment Section||Comment Section||
|http://<Base URL>/secure/attachment/10001/code%20alert%201.xml|http://<Base URL>/secure/attachment/10001/10001_code+alert+1.xml|

The *+* sign could potentially cause problems when JIRA is integrated with reverse proxy (refer to [this KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/URLs+with+a+Plus+Character+Trigger+a+404+Error+When+Using+an+IIS+Reverse+Proxy+Server])

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Attach a file with spaces in the name (eg. {{code alert 1.xml}})
# Add a comment using Wiki Markup to link the attachment {noformat} [^code alert 1.xml]{noformat}
# Check the URL from the Attachment and Comment Section

h3. Suggestion
Have all links use the same URL, preferably without the *+* sign to avoid problems with reverse proxies
fields.summary: Different links to attachment are used in Comment section and Attachment Section

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59249].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the External System Import does import new users, but nowhere in the documentation ([Importing issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracloud/importing-issues-737772291.html]) does it specify that it will create these users.

The documentation does mention what it will do with newly imported users, but not that it does it in the first place.

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the documentation to specifically mention it will import and create new users
fields.summary: External System Import documentation does not mention it will import new users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59248].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the External System Import does import new users, but nowhere in the documentation ([Importing issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracloud/importing-issues-737772291.html]) or during the import process does it specify that it will create these users.

The documentation does mention what it will do with newly imported users, but not that it does it in the first place.

The warning also does not occur in the process itself.
The problem here is that it can bring an instance over its licensing limit, and in JIRA Cloud, the new invoice is automatically generated and the billing admin may not see this has happened until they have already been charged.

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the documentation to specifically mention it will import and create new users, and put along the import process that it will do so and this may cause their bill to go up.
fields.summary: When using External System Import, should warn it will import new users

h3. Summary
Accented characters shown perfectly fine on JIRA 6.4.x for Text Gadget. But, when the same character is being used for JIRA 7.x for the same gadget, the character is not being shown correctly for *title only*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# For title, input é. Save the gadget.
# Do the same for JIRA 7.x.

h3. Expected Results
The title to be shown exactly the same as é character as how it's being shown on JIRA 6.4.x.
 !JIRA6.4.x.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
 !JIRA7.x.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Accented characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59237].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When Admin user renames Project and Project Key in JIRA there are a few places where the user must also edit fields in order to keep the naming convention the same across a JIRA instance. 

For example, if a user has a Screens named: ABC: Default Screen Scheme, once the Project name and Key has have been changed to XYZ, the Screen name will no update automatically. 

There is no smart logic that will recognize these text fields and update the related scheme names. Below is the list of fields that *may* need to be corrected after a project title/key change. 

* Issue Types Schemes Titles
* Workflow Schemes Titles
* Screens Schemes Titles
* Permission Schemes Titles

h3. Suggested Solution

Create way to change Scheme Titles upon a Project Name/Key change. This will reduce the amount of manual edits the Admin user will need to make. This will also prevent confusion from legacy project keys and titles in the future. 
 
h3. Workaround 

User must edit the text field manually after changing values for Project Key/Project Name via  JIRA Administration.
fields.summary: Improve Renaming Titles After Changing Project Name and Project Key

fields.description:
In the new project view (either the backlog or any of the sprint pages e.g "/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?projectKey=xxx&rapidView=yyy&view=planning"), pressing the "a" shortcut causes the "Delete All Attachments" dialog to be triggered. I'd expect the "assign" dialog (as documented in your keyboard shortcuts page). I've double checked it's not a letter case issue. This has previously worked in Jira Agile, during a previous release.

I think I can see the assign dialog pop up for a split second, before it's replaced by the delete all attachments dialog (not certain).

Confirmed on Chrome 47.0.2526.106 m (64-bit)
fields.summary: "a" Keyboard Shortcut working differently on Project pages

*SUMMARY*
Date picker custom field passing wrong value for current date and time.

*STEPS TO REPRODUCE*
# Create a custom field with type *Date Picker* or *Date Time Picker*
# Configure its default value with option *Use the current date as the default* ticked
# Click on *Set Default*

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The mentions feature currently does not take into account email addresses to match against the input from the user. 

However, it highlights this in the results leading to confusion for the end user.

1. - Go to a JIRA issue.
2.- Create a user (username=admin, email=admin@example.com)
3.- Start a comment and type " @adm".
4.- Notice that in the results dropdown both the username and email are highlighted even though only usernames are taking into account by the search.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should not highlight the email address as it's not part of the search criteria.

h3. Actual Results

Both username and email are highlighted by the dropdown.
fields.summary: Mentions should not highlight the email address on matches
Selecting "Last commented" for a "My Defaults" JQL result column makes many of the issues Red

h3. Summary
Application Access section on User Profiles synced from a LDAP(read-only with local groups) directory displays a warning message with 'null' value

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce

h3. Expected Results
- similar behavior to internal users, with option modify application access while viewing user profile or a warning message informing admins what the warning is indicating
!internal.png!
or 
!read-only.png!

h3. Actual Results

!read-only_local-groups.png!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59221].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 7 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}

Hi everyone,
 
Thanks for patience with us. We have identified the root cause of this issue and a fix has already been deployed to JIRA Cloud production. The fix has been deployed to all instances. 

At this point we consider this issue resolved. If you have any questions, please contact Atlassian Support.

Regards,

Oswaldo Hernández. 
JIRA Bugmaster.
[Atlassian].
{panel}

h3. Summary

After the upgrade in JIRA on Jan/3/2016, several customers were having a long delay in JIRA Incoming Email Handlers. Which didn't seem to be running.

After analysis, we found that a code change that inadvertently bypassed some bridging code that existed between JIRA's current scheduled job parameter format and the format that existed pre JIRA 7.0.  As a result, schedules that have not been modified since before 7.0 was deployed may not be read correctly by the scheduler.

Editing the service to some other delay and back to '1' rests the Service and fixes the issue:
!minute_service.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
After upgrade, some scheduled jobs are not running.  The Scheduler details page shows that the jobs parameters could not be read.

h3. Expected Results
Remain running as scheduled.

h3. Actual Results
Affected jobs do not run.

h3.Workaround
# In the Services (https://instance.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewServices!default.jspa) page, find the affected job.
# Go to the Incoming Email page
# Edit the Mail Handler
# Set the delay to the desired interval the handler should be executed (in minutes).
If the value is already set to 1, simply click on *Next* and *Save*.
# Check in Services page if the Service related to that was update correctly. The Service has the same name.
fields.summary: Services not running for custom Incoming Mail Handlers after upgrade on Jan/3/2016

fields.description:
JIRA does not allow to login as an internal directory user (say admin:admin) if there exists an LDAP directory and LDAP server does not respond.

Example: local JIRA with LDAP directory and internal directory.
LDAP server is not reachable.

I'm not able to login to JIRA using admin:admin. JIRA shows login screen, but when I try to login using admin:admin, it does not respond.

I also cannot upload my plugin using atlas-cli + pi.
fields.summary: Cannot login as internal directory user if LDAP is enabled and network is down

fields.description:
h3. Summary
User unable apply italic wiki style render on multiple lines characters.

 !Wiki Italic.png|thumbnail! 

 !Wiki italic 2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
JIRA 6.4.3 -> JIRA 7.0.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Type words in multiple line.
# Highlight the words and click "Italic" option from toolbar.

h3. Expected Results
All the highlighted words appear in Italic style

h3. Actual Results
Words do not appear in italic form. Instead JIRA only shows the underline before and after the words.

h3.Workaround
Highlight each of the words line by line and apply Italic.
fields.summary: Italic Wiki Style Renderer on Multiple Lines

h3. Summary
When navigating to another user's profile in JIRA, their user avatar replaces the one of the user logged in the top-right menu

h3. Environment
JIRA 6.0.0-OD-2016.01.1-0003

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Click on a username in the activity stream to navigate to their profile

!Screen Shot 2016-01-04 at 12.00.36.jpg!
!Screen_Shot_2016-01-04_at_12_01_58.jpg!

h3. Expected Results
Avatar in the menu should still match that of the user logged in

h3. Actual Results
Note that in the top right, the avatar in the menu will change to match the one on the page for that user

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: When accessing another user's profile, the avatar in the menu changes to match

fields.description:
h4. Summary
The watcher list overlaps the header when scrolling down the issue.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
Create an issue.
Add several comments in order to extend the body height.
Add some the users as "Watcher" for the issue.
Without click outside the Watcher List, scroll down until the list hits the page header.

h4. Expected Results
"Watchers List" should be hidden by the header

h4. Actual Results
 !Screen Shot 2016-01-04 at 5.34.35 pm.png|thumbnail! 
"Watchers List" overlaps the page header.
fields.summary: The watcher list overlaps the header when scrolling down the issue.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59211].
  {panel}

Our JIRA setup supports a large number of business units under our parent company.
Each company has it's own domain (~ 300 domains)
Our JIRA username format is based on the email address.

When trying to @ mention a user, once you get to the @ in the email address, the auto-match stops working

We do this as there's many users with the same firstname at different companies, so if we're looking for alex@companyXXX.com, we can't do it.

We can use [~alex@companyXXX.com] and it'll auto-link and email the user, but for finding the right user in the first place.
fields.summary: JIRA mentions - email as username
Allow Dashboards and Filters to be shared with individuals.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When Subscribing to Another Application's Gadgets ( Pie Chart Gadget ), this external Pie Chart Gadget is showing 6.2.x chart style.  


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA instances ( instance 1 and instance 2 )
# [Create a dashboard|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/customizing-the-dashboard-185729498.html#CustomizingtheDashboard-CreatingaDashboard] and add Pie Chart Gadget on both instance
# [Subscribe to another application's gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/subscribing-to-another-application-s-gadgets-720412277.html] in instance 1
# [Create Application link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/linking-to-another-application-357335370.html] in instance 1.


h3. Expected Results
The local Pie Chart Gadget style (image1 the light green chart) should be the same style with external Pie Chart Gadget 

h3. Actual Results
See image1 attached
 
h3. Notes
I am not sure if developers made it this way to differentiate internal and external Pie Chart gadget.

h3.Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Gadget Subscription loads 6.2 style gadgets in 6.4.x/7.0.x instance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59195].
  {panel}

h4. Scenario
JRA-34394 was implemented as an upgrade task to fix incorrect watch counts. However, the upgrade task triggers a reindexing that reindexes all of the available issues in the database, thus slows down the upgrade process.

h4. Suggestion
Only the affected issues (with incorrect watch counts) should be reindexed.
fields.summary: UpgradeTask_Build64001.java should only reindex affected issues
Upgrade tasks should trigger foreground reindexing instead of background reindexing

fields.description:
I have a javascript app running in the web that should make a REST API POST request to JIRA server (to create a new Story). I make the following call with all the fields and parameters supplied:
    http://localhost:8080/rest/api/2/issue

The browser makes a preliminary OPTIONS request since it detects that cross-site request is being made. Browser's OPTIONS request headers are:

 !image-2015-12-31-19-34-17-917.png|thumbnail! 

and JIRA's response is the following:

 !image-2015-12-31-19-34-26-715.png|thumbnail! 

As you can see, no `Access-Control-Allow-Origin` header is present there, which forces the browser to block my original POST request because of security reasons.
I read that I should add my frontend app to the Whitelists in Jira, I tried doing it and I have also tried to completely disable this feature but it had no effect.

 !image-2015-12-31-19-34-38-259.png|thumbnail! 

*Expected result:* Jira should send aforementioned header to enable Javascript browser clients use its REST API when whitelisting is disabled.
fields.summary: Jira does not send 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header in REST API "OPTIONS" method response

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59188].
  {panel}

Hello, 

I need to automatically assign a ticket after a specific transition, the assigned group will so depend on a specific custom field that was set during the creation of the ticket.
When the user hit the transition "T" (awaiting approval (for exp), the post-function should perform this verification:

if CustomField X value = V1 then assign the ticket to group G1
if CustomField X value = V2 then assign the ticket to group G2.
if CustomField X value = V3 then assign the ticket to group G3.
Is there any plugin to JIRA that allows me to do such conditional assignment ? 
or should it be a scrypt inserted anywhere on the post function of the transition ?

SEN-543446

Regards,
fields.summary: A field depend to the result of  another field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59183].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
Users have different JIRA email preferences. Some want more email, while others want less. The problem is that an admin determines the email preferences for all users. This results in spammy JIRA emails that get ignored.

h3. Story Point
* As a user, I'd like to specify that JIRA emails that I get

h3. Proposed Solution
*Email Based on Saved Filters*
Users already have the ability to write a query and save it as a filter. As an added feature, it would be nice to have a mail icon to specify email settings associated with that filter (see below).

_Proposed Mail Icons_
!Mail Settings.png|thumbnail!

In the Proposed Mail Icons (above), each color means something different:
* *{color:red}Red{color}* - No Email Preferences Configured / Do Not Send Me Email
* *{color:#14892c}Green{color}* - Email Preferences are Configured

*Activity Stream Style Settings*
In the Activity Stream, a user can setup certain filters. For example:

_Activity Stream Settings_
!Activity Stream Preferences.png|thumbnail!

I propose that if a user clicks the mail icon, then a similar menu appears. In this menu, users specifies one or more of the reasons to send a JIRA email. For Example, if a\(n):
* Comment is added
* Issue Created
* Issue Closed
* Issue is transitioned
* Issue Updated (field modified)

With this feature, a user can specify the JIRA emails that they get based on the saved filter.

*Display Options*
Custom fields are an important part of JIRA. Users will need the ability to specify which fields they want displayed in each email.
fields.summary: Email Settings based on Saved Filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59182].
  {panel}

Steps to replicate the problem:
# Create a project in JIRA
# Create an Issue related to that Project
# Create a webhook, which will trigger a build in Jenkins. In this webhook, write a JQL query as: * issuekey="AS-1" AND status changed FROM "In Review" TO "Done"* and tick mark the 'updated' checkbox under the *Issue* heading. 
# Create a workflow, (for example like: Create -> InProgress -> InReview -> Done)
# In the transition from InReview to Done, attach the webhook as a post function
# Create a workflow scheme, add the workflow created in above step to this workflow scheme
# Associate this workflow scheme to the project

Now, go to the issue, change the state from InProgress to InReview and then from InReview to Done. Since the webhook is attached to  the transition from InReview to Done, this fires the webhook. Again go to the respective issue and change its priority from Low to High, for example or add a comment to the issue. This will fire the webhook. So, basically any update in that issue, fires the webhook. The requirement is to make the webhook fire only when transition changes from InReview to Done and no other event/action.

Now, if you edit the webhook and untick the issue-updated checkbox and then repeat the steps mentioned above (first changing transition from InReview to Done, then updating any field in the issue), the webhook isnt fired.

So basically, we are unable to achieve the requirement, which is to create a webhook which should fire only on one event, i.e. a transition change, and it should not fire on any other  action/event/change in the issue. 

I couldnt devise a solution for this, even with JQL. Please look into this scenario and acknowledge back if its possible to achieve it in JIRA v6.4.12.

Also you can find attached a bit more detailed document with this post.

Thanks & Regards,
Ashish
fields.summary: Webhook cant be fired, if no event is checked

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59181].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

As a manager I want to be able to filter all the issues related to a specific Epic. Right now it is not possible to filter the subtasks without using a third party for this purpose. I believe this is a common need and should be added to JIRA Standard JQL search.
h3. Suggested Solution

Create a function to return all issues related to Epic, like the one provided by tempo {{parent in tempoEpicIssues(XXX-####, YYY-###, ZZZ-####)}}.
 This would allow searchs like: {{"Epic Link" in (XXX-####, YYY-###, ZZZ-####) OR parent in tempoEpicIssues(XXX-####, YYY-###, ZZZ-####)}}.
h3. Workaround

Install and add-on to provide the list of issues in a given Epic so the above suggestion can be used.
 This thread talks about some options: [JQL to show all issues AND subtasks in the Epic|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/177329/jql-to-show-all-issues-and-subtasks-in-the-epic].
fields.summary: Ability search for all issues under a given Epic (including subtasks)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59178].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*
Currently with the JIRA Installer release, we still provide users with outdated JAVA release. As for JIRA 7.0.5 the included JAVA is version 1.8u51. Since newer JAVA release contain important patches such as security patches (in version 1.8u66) it would be good idea to keep updating the JAVA version in each minor JIRA release.

*Suggested Solution*
Update JAVA versions in each JIRA Installer release.

*Workaround*
It's possible for the users to manually upgrade the JAVA even though they are using the installer but it could be slightly complicated. Even if the user managed to update the JAVA, if the user update JIRA using the installer, JAVA will be overwritten with the 1 provided with the installer.
fields.summary: Update JAVA in JIRA Installer

fields.description:
Please review documentation page: [Installing+JIRA+Data+Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+JIRA+Data+Center].
Section "5. Add a new JIRA node to the cluster", part: 
bq. Copy the local home directory from the first node to this new node.

Will leed to JIRA index corruption. Proposed change: 
"Stop JIRA on the first node and then copy the local JIRA Home directory from the first node to the new node"
fields.summary: Documentation request: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+JIRA+Data+Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59175].
  {panel}

*Suggestion Description*
As an Admin, I have certain users on my JIRA instance that require a persistent session(no timeout), however we would need to restrict the change to just specific users.

*Actually Available*
- There currently exist a feature that lets you customize the timeout however this is system wide as seen here:
-* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira062/changing-the-default-session-timeout-588581487.html

*Expected*
- Add a feature so the Admin can control session timeout per user.
fields.summary: Add ability to configure individual user Session Timeout

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Having multiple Label type fields in an issue will have the Label's suggestions to provide incorrect results when the suggestions are of the same label value.

h3. Environment
* Setup 2 or more Label type fields in an issue 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create "Custom Label" field of Label type
# Add "Custom Label" to the respective project's screen
# Create Issue A and Issue B, have Issue A the value of below (to ensure the label value is created)
#* (system) Label = "one" and "five"
#* Custom label = "four" and "five"
# Open Issue B and update with following value
#* (system) Label = "one" and "five"
#* Custom label try to add "five"

h3. Expected Results
"Custom label" to return the correct Label's suggestion.

h3. Actual Results
"Custom label" *did not* return the correct Label's suggestion as seen below. It assumes the existing value never existed with "New value" written.
!customlabel.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
The auto-complete suggestions for the label return empty value for the word that is trying to be searched using {{/rest/api/1.0/labels/10021/suggest?customFieldId=10300&query=five&_=1542954046711}} URL
{code:borderStyle=dashed}
{"token":"five","suggestions":[]}
{code}


h3.Workaround
_None_
fields.summary: Multiple Label fields in an Issue will have Incorrect Auto-complete Suggestion

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the Project list page (Administration > Project) is zoom out until the horizontal scroll bar appears, the JIRA panel at the top is not expanded along and leave a gap for the enlarged area.


h3. Environment
Browsers: Firefox, IE, Chrome
 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Go to Administration > Project.
2. Zoom out the page until the horizontal scroll bar appears.
3. Drag the scroll bar to the right and observe the top panel.


h3. Expected Results
When the scroll bar is dragged to the right position, the panel is expanded.


h3. Actual Results
There's an empty space/gap at the end of the panel, as if the panel is not expanded as per screenshot below.
 !gap.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
- Use a higher screen resolution.
- Use smaller fonts for the browser.
- Scaling to make fonts and all items smaller.
fields.summary: UI shows empty space on top right when scroll to the right
Browser crashes on adding a very large comment with a {code} wiki syntax

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59144].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*
Currently in JIRA, Admins will have to go to Setting -> Issues -> Workflows and choose specific workflow to edit the conditions/validator of the workflow.

*Suggested Solution*
Add function in JIRA to display condition/validator in the workflow diagram available in issue diagram and allow JIRA Administrator to edit the transitions selected in the workflow diagram.

 !Test.png|thumbnail! 

*Workaround*
Currently there are no workaround for this.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Admin to edit Workflow from Issue Page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59143].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There is a need for further clarifications in the JIRA REST API Reference:
# https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/version-createVersion
#* Here the request parameter: *"archived": false,* and *"released": true,* are given. However, these values cannot be set during version creation. As with the UI, a version has to go through stages, where it first will have to be created. Then a created version can be *released* and then a *released* version may be *Archived*. Therefore this customer can only create with the above REST API. They will have to use the update REST call to update the version to released and then again to archive. 
#* User should either pass  "releaseDate" or "userReleaseDate", not both.
# https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/issue-editIssue
#* As explained in this JAC comment: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-224338?focusedCommentId=5839137&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-583913, clarify the process of updating fixVersions using the above REST API.

h3. Suggested Solution
Clarify the above in the documentation.
fields.summary: As a user, I want the JIRA REST API Reference to be clearer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59142].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*
Currently in JIRA, if a users are not able to view the condition/validator of the workflow of the workflow diagram available in the issue page. Admins would like this ability so the users can understand why they are not able to perform specific transitions.

*Suggested Solution*
Add function in JIRA to display condition/validator in the workflow diagram available in issue diagram. 

 !Test.png|thumbnail! 

*Workaround*
Currently there are no workaround for this.
fields.summary: Allow Users to view Workflow Condition/Validator from Issue Page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59141].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, sub-tasks have to be in the same project as parent issue.

fields.summary: Allow sub-task to be in different projects (from the parent issue's project)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59140].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
User is experiencing an issue where  when they attempt to open a file exported from JIRA by double clicking on the file or dragging the file into an open excel instance, the file fails to open.
- The described methods open other .xls files.
User would need to use the {{File > Open > Select your file}} option provided from the file menu to open the issue to which they receive the following warning:
{code}The file format and the file extension of 'cup work done (projektflusterei jira) -2-2.xls not match. possibly the file is damaged or not sure. You should not open if you do not trust its source. Let them open the file anyway{code}

*Platform*
* JIRA 7.0.2
* Office 365 and Excel 2016.

*Steps to reproduce*
- Search for issues in your JIRA issue navigator.
- Export the selected issues using the Excel(columns) option
- Double click the exported file to open it in Excel or drag the file into an Excel from office 365

*Scenario One*
{panel}
*Expected behavior*
The file is opened with no errors or warnings.

*Actual Behavior*
The file is not opened
{panel}

*Scenario 2: Open via File menu Excel 2016*
{panel}
*Expected behavior*
The file is opened with no errors or warnings.

*Actual Behavior*
The file is opened but with the following warning.

{code}
The file format and the file extension of 'Cup Work done (projektflusterei jira) -2-2.xls not match. possibly the file is damaged or not sure. You should not open if you do not trust its source. Let them open the file anyway
{code}

!PastedGraphic-1.png!
fields.summary: Security Warning When Opening Exported Excel files from JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59138].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no way to sort the version (as in Unreleased and Released) under the affect version field.

For now, the Released versions are always placed on top of the list of Affect Version/s field.

There are customers would prefer to have the Unreleased version to be listed on top of the list under the  Affect Version/s field.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option to sort the list in Affect Version/s field.
fields.summary: sort version in affect version field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59136].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Comments in JIRA have a link at the top right of the comment box with a chain icon, that links to that specific comment when clicked. In Chrome v47, clicking on this won't focus on the comment. It will be highlighted but the user still needs to scroll manually through the page to find it.

h3. Environment
* Chrome Version 47
* JIRA 7.1
Works normally in JIRA 7.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue with multiple comments
# Click on the Chain icon.

*Expected Results:* The page refreshes and the comment is in focus on the screen and highlighted. 
Actual Results:* The page refreshes but the comment is only highlighted.
No errors in the Browser console

h3. Notes
It works as expected in Firefox
fields.summary: Comment links don't focus on Comment when clicked

fields.description:
Hello Team,

Summary:
The details of the users are hidden by the watcher UI dialog. The user details are on the back side of the watcher UI panel/dialog which ideally should on the front side so that the details are visible.

The issue has been reproduced with JIRA 7.0.5 and the screenshots has been attached.

System details:
{code}
JIRA 7.0.5
Java Version	1.8.0_60
Database type	postgres72
Database version	9.4.5
Version	7.0.5
Build Number	70114{code}

Thanks and best regards,
Michael
fields.summary: JIRA Issue watcher UI pane, User details are hidden by the watcher pane.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
We've been using the create project rest api (new for JIRA 7) to create projects for JIRA migrations and noticed that the projects that we create using it are not getting assigned the default notification scheme when no notification scheme id is provided.
The Permissions Scheme is set to the default scheme (according to project type) whithout having to specify the id in the rest call.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create a project using the rest API <Jira Base URL>/rest/api/2/project

h3. Expected Results
The project is created with the default Notification scheme associated

h3. Actual Results
The project is created without any Notification scheme associated.
 
h3. Notes
Seems like the resolution to the issue JRA-14337 should apply here as well.

h3. Workaround
After the project has been created, go to Project settings > Notifications, and link a scheme to the project.
fields.summary: Create Project REST API doesn't set default notification scheme
Ability to select inactive users in an User Picker

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce (these are the steps received from customers)
# Upgrade to JIRA 7.0
# Attempt to login to JIRA

h3. Expected Results
# Login is successful

h3. Actual Results
Login fails with the below exception:
{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalStateException: User 'xxxx' exists but has no unique key mapping.
at com.atlassian.jira.user.util.DefaultUserManager.getUserByName(DefaultUserManager.java:262)
at com.atlassian.jira.security.login.JiraSeraphAuthenticator.getUser(JiraSeraphAuthenticator.java:36)
at com.atlassian.seraph.auth.DefaultAuthenticator.login(DefaultAuthenticator.java:101)
at com.atlassian.seraph.filter.PasswordBasedLoginFilter.runAuthentication(PasswordBasedLoginFilter.java:127)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Refer to our [JIRA Login Fails With the Message - User exists but has no unique key mapping|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Login+Fails+With+the+Message+-+User+exists+but+has+no+unique+key+mapping] KB for the workaround.

h3.Real World

Your "workaround" does not work and the issue has been closed despite a number of customers still reporting the issue. It now seems to have worked its way into Jira 7 Software. NONE of my Crowd users have been ported over, not one, so that I now cannot access the system at all.
fields.summary: JIRA Login Fails With the Message - User xxxx has no unique key mapping
On Issue Navigator, create an option to sort by number of comments the results of searches.
Show the percentage of estimation in Issue View Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59125].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Admins receive email notification only when 
- An add-on license has expired
- Maintenance for an add-on has expired
- A user requests an add-on (system administrators only)
- A user updates the add-on request (system administrators only)

Admins do not receive email notification when there's an update available for the installed add-ons.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow admins to receive email notification when there's an update available for the installed add-ons.

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Email notification for add-ons available update
Allow description and comment fields unlimited text (no character limit)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
User unable to view Workflow transition in issue page if an issue is moved from an issue with different workflow to another issue with different workflow at same time.

 !Bug.JPG|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment

JIRA 6.3.15

This is issue is not reproduce able in a instance of small data set. To reproduce this issue it's likely the instance must satisfy the following conditions:
# Large data set. 
# The moving process by 2 users but me done in nearly identical time. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new Issue in specific project where issues have different workflow type.
# Ask 2 users to move the Issue from 1 issue type to another.
# Refresh the page to see the transition hidden.

h3. Expected Results

Issue type is moved to the last issue type choosen and workflow transition is displayed to permitted users.

h3. Actual Results

Issue type is moved but workflow transition is hidden.

h3.Workaround

There is a existing feature request here :

* [Implement issue locking| https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-6146]
For now Atlassian developers has mentioned using the 2 plugins as workaround for this issue:

# [JIRA Issue Edit Lock|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/net.koncis.atlassian.jira-issue-edit-lock]
# [Who is Looking|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/whoslooking-connect/cloud/overview]
fields.summary: Workflow Transition Missing after 2 Users Move the same Issue at same Time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59121].
  {panel}

Current Behavior:
Smart Query has, on more than one occasion, ruined a perfectly good search with its smartness.

There have been zero occasions where I have found it useful.

For example, if I search for "duplicate x", I want to find bugs in my software where something is getting duplicated. IE, "duplicate records" or "duplicate users" or "duplicate locations".

I am not looking for JIRA issues that are duplicate. And by automagically changing my filter to issue type of duplicate is just wrong.

Desired Behavior:
Add a feature to turn this silliness off.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In the Search Box in the upper right hand corner, type in "Duplicate something".
2. Search.
3. Note that a filter has been set for Duplicate Issues.
Thanks
fields.summary: Disabling Smart Query in JIRA would be helpful
Token is getting rejected upon logging in to UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59116].
  {panel}

*Suggestion Summary*
A user may want to export issues at the end of each month for records and having to do the process manually seems taxing.

Can a feature be added into JIRA that allows a user set queries that it needs to generate results for from the issue navigation page and automatically export the returned result in the format selected by the user?

*Current*
This feature is unavailable in JIRA with the only available means being to send notification for saved filters the user has subscribed to.

*Expected*
A feature in JIRA that lets JIRA generate the result and automatically export the issues returned as results to a format the customer specified when configuring the feature.
fields.summary: Add Feature to Automate Query and Export to Excel or PDF of Issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59114].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
# For some reason, customers decided to change the  primary email of Google apps users, from lastname@mycompany.com to firstname.lastname@mycompany.com.
# User accidentally created GApps user with firstnameLastname, but the actual one should be firstname.lastname

When admin tries to edit the username for GApps user, system prompts the message:
{noformat} XXX is a Google Apps user and cannot be renamed {noformat}
This is quite troublesome if recreate a new account for the GApps user as there are many issues, comments, permissions, and etc, associated with this user.

h3. Suggested Solution
Since the ability to edit usernames is released from JIRA 6.0 [JRA-1549|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-1549], hope that this feature is available for GApps users as well.
fields.summary: Ability to Edit Username for GApps Users

fields.description:
This page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver070/advanced-workflow-configuration-749383189.html

Note at the top:
{quote}
Also on this page:
* Customize how transitions appear
* Global transitions
{quote}

When clicking on "Global transitions" the URL will update with the anchor information, but the page will not change focus, looking through the page there's only one mention of "Global transitions". I'd say it probably needs to be re-added, the ability to configure Global transitions is a pretty important feature of JIRA's workflows.
fields.summary: Global transitions missing from documentation
Include minimum display width that JIRA can support in documentation
